It's a special interest of mine and have annoyed everyone in personal life by talking about it too much so here is a space 😄 Look out for themed events!

Disclaimer: we don't agree with Rowling's transphobia and strongly condemn it. This is a queer positive, disability positive, BPoC & religious minority safe space.

Types of sessions:
Character analysis time!!
Fanfic writing session
Alan Rickman interlude (film nights!)
General Harry Potter chats

name: Writing for the Soul of the World in London
description:
That stories have consequences is at the heart of this bimonthly writing salon open to writers of all levels, working across all genres, fiction and nonfiction. We gather from around the world for philosophical conversations on writing in light of the mythopoetic writing theory *Universal Grammar of Story™* developed by Dr. Hazel Denhart. In these salons we contemplate the ancient writer archetype, essential components of storytelling, and how to gracefully navigate writer’s block. We also consider the responsibility we have to our readers and audiences by recognizing that like our grown children our stories must leave us for the wider world where they influence others. Writers are the cultural scouts guiding society along the uncharted edges of an increasingly dangerous social frontier.
The salon is free to all with a suggested donation of $5.00 for those with the means to do so to help cover the Meetup and Zoom expenses.
All participants can find complementary chapters from Universal Grammar of Story and the companion workbook at the [Invisible Press online store.](https://invisiblepress.com/store/) Scroll down to the bottom of the page for sample copies
For more information visit T[he Invisible Press Website.](https://invisiblepress.com/)

name: Oxford Goddesses: Creative, Mind and Spiritual meet-up
description:
Welcome women who yearn to talk about all things creative, mind and spirit! I’d love to bring together a group of likeminded women in the local area. To start with we can chat and get to know each other. Starting topics may include: 
great books or podcasts about mind, spirit and creativity
passions such as writing, reading, art or music
our own personal spiritual, healing or creative journey

After that we could start doing some activities, depending on general consensus such as theatre trips, arts and craft afternoons, book club, writing meet-ups or forest walks.

The aim is to have fun, feel connected and expand our interests.

name: Brighton Authors’ Group
description:
A new community for all Sussex-based authors.
Writing books can be a frustrating, lonely business. Just how frustrating and lonely is something only authors can truly understand. Hours spent hunched over a laptop (or avoiding it), trying to connect with a silent, invisible audience. Infrequent bouts of brilliance popping up unreliably among days of self-doubt. The tyranny of the flashing cursor. Then there's the trying to find a publisher, then, when you do, battling with the publisher. The daily fight with what Stephen Pressfield calls the Resistance. And doing it all on your own, while living in your head.

Unless you do it, you won't get it. But if you do, this probably all sounds very familiar. But what if you didn't have to do it all on your own?

I’m gauging interest for a new group that will be the antidote to author isolation. It doesn't matter if you write fiction or non-fiction; if you're traditionally published or self-published; or whether you work full time or part time. All that matters is that you are serious about your work and would like to relax and chat with those who get what author life is like.

We'll probably meet up on Zoom at first but in person as soon as possible. But I can't do it on my own. In fact, that's the point. I need other authors. So, are you in? If you think you might be, sign up and we'll take it from there.

name: Shepperton Wordsmiths Writers' Club
description:
Writing doesn't have to be a lonely pursuit!

Shepperton Wordsmiths is a biweekly writing group meeting every other Tuesday to provide a safe, social, and supportive forum for sharing and improving our writing.

Sometimes we start with an exercise we set at the previous meeting. Sometimes we start with a brief initial discussion of some technical aspect of writing, style, publication, or production, followed by member readings with group supportive feedback and respectful critique.

Readings will be voluntary, so no worries if you just want to observe and listen to gain confidence.

Meeting venues will be the Thames Court Pub, TW17 9LJ, although we sometimes have a boat ride or seasonal party.

Fee of £3 per Meetup.
